page.title: 16GREENBANKS PRE_FABS BLAYDON.
page.content: There are twenty one pre-fabs at Greenbanks which is a small estate located opposite St. Thomas More R.C. School. They were built in 1946 as short term housing for people who came back after the last war. These houses are made of corrugated asbestos panels. They have three bedrooms, alounge, a kitchen and a bathroom. The occupants expressed lots of complaints about the pre-fabs. Many of them are over fifty years of age and complain about "the damp draughty roofs", "the gardens are too large to manage","the street lights do not work","the estate misses out on normal things such as telephone boxes and post boxes". The occupants found the pre-fabs were hot in summer and cold in the winter. The majority of people thought the houses should be knocked down and re-built.
